title: Let people flying into Delhi from abroad take connecting domestic flights, Govt orders airlinesNEW DELHI: International passengers flying into India on Saturday faced trouble in being cleared by airlines for taking connecting domestic flights to their hometowns. Later

Coronavirus in India: People in Agra avoid visiting religious sites
content:
Muslims in Agra postponed their pilgrimage to Ajmer Sharif, while Hindus are
avoiding to visit temples in Braj after social organisations and
intellectuals in the district urged locals to abide by Prime Minister
Narendra Modi's Janata Curfew request.

title: Kanika Kapoor must start behaving like patient, not a star: Hospital
content:
The Lucknow hospital, where Kanika Kapoor is admitted, said that the
Bollywood singer must start behaving like a patient, not a star.

title: Situation similar to Great Depression if pandemic not controlled on time, says Ruchir Sharma | Exclusive
content:
Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Ruchir Sharma, Global investor and
author, said: "If pandemic rolls on and you don't get it under control over
the next month or so, which allows some activities to come back to normal in
early summer -- in May, June, then we are looking at something far major and
the only parallel to the situation will be the Great Depression."

title: Covid-19 pandemic: Manika Batra shares PM Modi's Janta Curfew message
content:
India's table tennis sensation Manika Batra took to social media to spread
Prime minister Narendra Modi's message of Janta Curfew on Sunday.

title: Coronavirus: Rajasthan to be in lockdown from Sunday till March 31
content:
Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said that Rajasthan will be in a lockdown from
Sunday till March 31 "to protect lives of people in the state".

title: Clapping won't help, big financial package need of hour: Rahul Gandhi
content:
Rahul Gandhi pointed out that the coronavirus outbreak was a serious attack
on our fragile economy and took potshots at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's
call for beating of "thalis" in the honour of those working to contain the
spread of the virus.

title: Make Janata Curfew a huge success tomorrow, defence minister Rajnath Singh appeals to people
content:
Rajnath Singh appreciated the efforts of the various arms and services of the
armed forces which have been proactive in evacuating people from Covid-19
affected countries such as China, Iran, Italy and Japan and sheltering them
at various quarantine facilities.

title: Covid-19: Faridkot Police registers case against wedding hall owner for violating gathering norms
content:
A routine check done by the Faridkot Police on Saturday revealed that one
wedding hall owner was violating the directions by organising a wedding
ceremony.

title: India fights coronavirus: Epidemiologists estimate what situation will be like in next few months
content:
India Today TV spoke to experts and epidemiologists on Saturday to get an
overview of what situation will be in the next few days, weeks and months as
more and more Covid-19 positive cases continue to emerge in India.

title: Chinese footballer Wu Lei diagnosed with coronavirus in Spain
content:
Chinese football star Wu Lei, who plays for Espanyol in Spain, has been
diagnosed with the coronavirus, the Chinese Football Association (CFA) said
on Saturday.

title: 262 Indians stranded in Rome to arrive in Delhi on Sunday: Health ministry
content:
In a press conference on Saturday, Joint Secretary in Ministry of Health, Luv
Agrawal, said: "1600 Indians and people from other countries were kept in
quarantine centres in India. Today [early Sunday morning] 262 people from
Rome, mostly students will come and they will be kept in quarantine centres."

title: Twitter removes Rajinikanth's Janata Curfew video. This is why
content:
On March 21, Rajinikanth took to Twitter to release a video and a statement
asking people to observe Janata Curfew tomorrow. However, Twitter has removed
the video for spreading misinformation.
